notes_display: Obv./rev. blind spot; obv. Slightly double struck; rev. die cracks
numismatic_provenance_s: Classical Numismatic Group, Lancaster, PA; 11/05/2008; E198 (165)
issue_obverse_figure_s: Right profile of Shapur III on frontal bust
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: crown with three arcades, the latter enclosing lily-like object; covered korymbos; two ribbons commencing to the left below the korymbos, pointing upwards, pearl diadem, diadem ribbons commencing below ball of hair, pointing upwards, earing consisting of two elements; neck-line of tunica edged with row of pearls; double row of pearls running the shoulders to the breast ornament (only upper part visible); dotted border
issue_obverse_legend_s: 11 h l. o. mzdysn bgy šhpwhry MRKAn MRKA 'ry'n W 'nyr'n MNW ctry MN yzd'n| mazdēsn bay Šābuhr šāhān šāh Ērān ud Anērān kē čihr az yazdān|"The Mazda-worshiping divine Shapur, King of Kings of the Iranians and non-Iranians, whose seed (image|splendour) is from the gods"; barbarized
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; round altar shaft; to the left and right of the shaft ribbons pointing downwards, four altar slabs; altar flames depicted by several lines in S-form; to the left and right of altar attendant with stylized crown of Shapur III, holding a barsom with both hands, both figures facing inwards; dotted border
